title: Charges filed in murder of woman in front of 3 children
content:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -
Charges have been filed in connection to a Thursday morning murder of a woman in front of three children.
Derrick Williams, 31 of Kansas City, KS, has been charged with murder in the first degree, three counts of armed criminal action and three counts of endangering the welfare of a child.
Officers were called to the Stonewall Court Apartments on Independence and Wabash avenues about 5:07 a.m. on a reported disturbance.
When they got there, a man flagged them down and told them that a woman was dead in an apartment. The woman was identified as 32-year-old Denise Gayle.
Court records said officers found Williams naked in the front of the building. He told them he had shot a woman.
According to court documents, officers believed Williams was under the influence of drugs.
Inside the apartment police said they found three children crying. One of them told an officer, "He killed my mom."
Before he killed Gayle, one of the children said Williams put the gun in the child's mouth and hit another child on the head, according to court documents.
Police had taken a woman into custody at the scene, but it's unclear how she may have been connected to the death.
Prosecutors asked that Williams' bond be set at $300,000.
